column4: Can someone look at my fstab and tell me why my cdroms arre not mounting? http://pastebin.ubuntu.com/81945/
mine is the same as yours except for the utf part
udf you mean?  do you know what that flag is?
nvm I see utf but i still dont know what it means...
yours... /dev/scd1       /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec,utf8 0       0...   mine... /dev/scd0       /media/cdrom0   udf,iso9660 user,noauto,exec 0       0
ok i try to remove it and sudo mount -a
It is probably another issue... but wanted to point out the dif from mine and yours.. are those drives sata or ide
the cdroms are ide
still no go....
it is still oh dark 30 here.. not ready for real questions yet.. sorry
no
can you be a little more specific?
mac address is not encrypted and can be caught and spoofed
The only reason I ask is that there is a bug in the intel 3945 driver that won't allow any type of WEP encryption.
thank you I thought so I just needed someone to confirm.
If security is an issue, get a card with native drivers.
iwl3945 is a native driver but its currently suffered a regression.
sidd1 thank you. You've both answered my question.
you're a smart guy, do you have any suggestions for an online resource that will explain in newb friendly terms how to compile a custom kernel with built-in drivers?
nope
at the login you can pick which you want to use
thanks but thats not the question i asked, I know how to chose gnome or kde session im talking about the login daemon, tritium was correct
